Complete the following questions to practice the skills you have learned in this lesson.

  1. The cost for an upcoming field trip is $15 per student. The cost of the field trip \(C\), in dollars, is a function of the number of students \(x\). Select two possible outputs for the function defined by \(C(x)=15x\).

Correct! 30, 90

Try again. Revisit activities 4.12.1-4.12.2.

The correct answers are 30, 90.

  1. A rectangle has an area of \(24 cm^2\). Function \(f\) gives the length of the rectangle, in centimeters, when the width is \(w\) cm.
    Determine which values, in centimeters, are possible inputs of the function. <<<<<<< HEAD Select three that apply. =======

    Select three possible that apply.

    >>>>>>> 2613d9f709e3856abfc7b272669e258f1d7bff8e

Correct! 3, 0.5, and 48 are possible inputs. Not possible: -6, 0.

Try again. Revisit activities 4.12.1-4.12.2.

The correct answers are 3, 0.5, and 48 are possible inputs. Not possible: -6, 0.

  1. Select three possible input-output pairs for the function \(y=x^3\).

Correct!  \((-1,-1)\), \(\left(\frac12,\frac18\right)\), \((4,64)\)

Try again. Revisit activity 4.12.3.

The correct answers are: \((1,-1)\), \(\left(\frac12,\frac18\right)\), \((4,64)\).

  1. Two functions are defined by the equations \(f(x)=5−0.2x\) and \(g(x)=0.2(x+5)\).
     
    Select two possible statements that are true about the functions.

Correct! 

Try again. Revisit activity 4.12.3

The correct answers are \(f(3)>0\), \(g(-1)=0.8\).

  1. Is the relation graphed below a function?

Correct! No, this is not a function because 4 maps to both -1 and −3.

Try again. Revisit activity 4.12.3.

The correct answer is; No, this is not a function because 4 maps to both -1 and −3.

  1. Is the relation graphed below a function?

Correct! no; This is not a function because −3 maps to both 4 and −4.

Try again. Revisit activities 4.12.3.

The correct answer is no; This is not a function because −3 maps to both 4 and −4.

  1. Is 30 a possible output in the range?

Correct! No; 30 is not a possible value in the range because all values of the range must be multiples of 7.

Try again. Revisit activities 4.12.5.

The correct answer is 30 is not a possible value in the range because all values of the range must be multiples of 7.
